Plu.</Au></SGrm></aS1><aS1><Def>productive of the true essence of tragedy<Expl>i.e. of pity and fear</Expl></Def><aS2><Indic>of a play, an action in a play</Indic><Tr>tragic</Tr><Au>Arist.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>superl., of Euripides</Indic><Au>Arist.</Au></aS2></aS1><aS1><Def>conveying the same effects or having the same associations as tragic drama</Def><aS2><Indic>of a person, ref. to his appearance</Indic><Tr>like a tragic hero</Tr><Au>Ar.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of a tyrant</Indic><Tr>straight out of tragedy<Expl>because he suffered a sudden reversal of fortune</Expl></Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of a ranting accuser</Indic><Tr>histrionic</Tr><Au>D.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of a style of speech</Indic><Tr>high-flown</Tr><Au>Pl. Arist.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of behaviour, circumstances</Indic><Tr>theatrical, spectacular</Tr><Au>Plb. Plu.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of a person's temperament</Indic><Tr>imperious</Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of a spectacle, events, sufferings</Indic><Tr>distressing, pathetic</Tr><Au>Plb. Plu.</Au></aS2><aS2><Indic>of circumstances</Indic><Tr>as if belonging to drama<Expl>rather than real life</Expl></Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></aS2></aS1> <aS1><Indic>of falsehood</Indic><Tr>tragical<Expl>w. allusion both to the fictional nature of tragic drama and to the double nature of the goatlike Pan</Expl></Tr><Au>Pl.</Au></aS1> <aS1><Def>belonging to a goat</Def><aS2><Indic>of horns on a helmet</Indic><Tr>of a goat</Tr><Au>Plu.</Au></aS2></aS1> <Adv><vHG><HL>τραγικῶς</HL><PS>adv</PS><FG><Deg><Lbl>compar.</Lbl><Form>τραγικώτερον</Form></Deg></FG></vHG> <advS1><Tr>theatrically, in the high style, with poetic exaggeration</Tr><ModVb>ref. to speaking<Au>Pl.
